intro: Baccharis oligantha, commonly known as silverleaf baccharis, is a shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Baccharis oligantha is also noted for its aromatic leaves, which release a pleasant scent when crushed.
